shows.title: Andy Irvine & Quilty
shows.text: TogetherAndy Irvine & Quilty offer a unique musical journey taking in the cultures of their two native countries, Ireland and Sweden.  Andy Irvine is one of the great Irish singers, his voice one of a handful of truly great ones that gets to the very soul of Ireland. He has been hailed as "a tradition in himself." Musician, singer and songwriter, Andy has maintained his highly individual performing skills throughout his over 55-year career. From Sweeney's Men in the mid 60s, to the enormous success of Planxty in the 70s, his duo with Paul Brady in the later 70s and then from Patrick Street to Mozaik, LAPD and Usher’s Island, Andy has been a world music pioneer and an icon for traditional music and musicians.  Ever the man for new pastures, Andy has played concerts all over Europe and has toured many times in Australia, New Zealand, the United States and Canada. He was also undertaken extensive tours of Costa Rica, Panama, Nicaragua, Japan, Iceland, Faroe Islands, Argentina and Chile.  Although an integral part of the finest Irish bands of our time, Andy Irvine continues along the path he set for himself so long ago - a vibrant career as a solo artist in the old style, a teller of tales and maker of music  The Swedish band Quilty is a renowned interpreter of traditional Irish music and considered being the foremost band of the Irish folkmusic scene in Scandinavia.  In 2020 Quilty was nominated Band of the Year at the national Folk & World Music Gala event.  Since 2020 Quilty has been touring with the program Out on the Ocean - sea shanties, emigration songs, love ballads and songs about epic adventures at sea in a salty and tar scented concert programme combining Irish and Scottish songs with the Atlantic Ocean as a backdrop, as well as the traditional music from their own country - Sweden.

shows.title: Cân Sing Span Arts Singing Workshops
shows.text:
Cân Sing will now be taking place at the SPAN Building,     Narberth  , at the regular time of 7.00 pm - 9.00 pm       Limited sapces - Book by choosing the date below.    

  Cân Sing is a relaxed environment in which we sing for the sake of singing!  

  Join vocal practitioner Molara for an exploratory celebration of singing, work on strengthening the voice, overcoming some of the physical and emotional barriers to singing openly and freely, and above all singing for enjoyment.  
  The repertoire is varied with songs from Georgia, Ghana, Zimbabwe, and Hawaii with a few shanties and some pop thrown in for good measure.  
  The group has been meeting for many years, with new additions along the way. It's perfect if you are looking to sing regularly in a pressure free environment, or whether you fancy dropping in for a sing every so often. The pace of the teaching is easily accessible to all, with no time restraints.  
  Every 1st and 3rd Monday of the month, except Bank Holidays.  

          7.00 pm - 9.00 pm      SPAN Arts Building, Narberth SA67 7AG   
   Sessions £7     For ticket holders who need access support to attend, we offer a free ticket for their companion, carer, or personal assistant. Contact    01834 869323  to book your carers ticket.

shows.title: VE Day celebrations
shows.text: The 80th anniversary of VE Day will be ON THE 8TH MAY and we intend to mark it at Rhosygilwen with some music and reminiscences from the time. There will be traditional food available including singing around the piano, and dance hits by the Hornets from the 50s and 60s. Fancy dress will be encouraged and you will get a free drinks voucher if you attend in dress of the day. There will also be reminiscences from people around at the time who remember the celebrations.

shows.text: Sea Trust Wales is a charity working to better understand and help protect local marine wildlife, and to raise awareness in the local community. We aim to inspire people to care about their local marine wildlife by opening their eyes to the stunning diversity of wildlife around the Welsh coast and engaging them in its protection.

shows.title: An Autopsy of a Mother, a Bear and a Fridge
shows.text:
An Autopsy of a Mother, a Bear and a Fridge     By Mover, Maker and Mother - Deborah Light    ‘Rage hides a wound’   Sharon Blackie    You are warmly invited to witness the examination of three seemingly unconnected   objects  .     As Deborah uncovers connective tissue, between mother, bear and fridge, she reveals her own vulnerability, anger, humour and strength  . With cold clinical brutality, warm openness and hot feminist rage   she exposes both pers  onal experiences and patriarchal systems that place pressure on the female body.        A powerful and intimate dance/theatre experience.
   A script (paper or digital) is available in advance on request and at the performance. This script contains visual reference points and details about the music/sound elements contained in the production.

    Tickets:
£12 / £8 concession     Age: 14+         Friday 16  th   May 2025   7pm – 9pm    



Canolfan Hermon   Hermon, Glogue  SA36 0DT

shows.title: The London Community Gospel Choir
shows.text: From humble beginnings in 1982 London Community Gospel Choir (LCGC) have gone on to become Europe’s leading Gospel brand and one of the most in demand choirs across continents of the world, creating a wall of soulful sound that is both memorable and inspirational. LCGC regularly grace many of the UK’s greatest events    They are dubbed by the British press as ‘the nation’s favourite choir’, LCGC are the first point of call to support not just your high-end entertainment gatherings, but very involved on the front line in support of charities and global humanitarian causes too    Having purpose and foundation in life, LCGC continue to illustrate their intentions in breaking boundaries, sharing hope and to display true versatility, this gives them the drive to go form strength to strength. They are an eclectic mix of united nations, ages and from diverse backgrounds uniquely blended together, making this choir a truly special blend of talent, voices and personalities    Watch the choir on https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vlRoeomVzWg

shows.title: NOSWEITHIAU MEIC AGORED  |  OPEN MIC NIGHTS
ROYAL BALLET & OPERA: DIE WALKURE (12A TBC)
The Onyx Piano Quintet-Philip Glass to Schubert
shows.text: David Harris -Violin, Alexandra Harrison – Viola, Chloe Chen – Cello, Thomas Judge – Double Bass, Asia Movsovic – Piano    The ONYX Ensemble is a piano quintet formed of students based in Manchester at the Royal Northern College of Music and is one of the only professional groups in the world to work solely with this instrumentation. Due to their rare instrumentation, it has allowed the group to explore a wide range of chamber works that are incredibly unique and as a group aim to put underrepresented works side by side with the “classics” that audiences are typically used to hearing at chamber concerts. The ensembles performances have been noted as being incredibly energetic and full of passion, due to the innovative programmes they put together and the vibrant playing of the members. All coming from very different musical backgrounds, each individual member brings something special to the group while also balancing their own musical commitments outside of the ensemble. Constantly pushing for new works for their instrumentation, they have collaborated with renowned composers including Danny Elfman and Xavier Foley, as well as encourage new and upcoming composers to explore their ideas with the ensemble. The group have various exciting projects ahead including a recital series at Manchester Cathedral, multiple European and World premieres, and a tour of South Wales this May.       - ‘Die Wolfsjungen’ by Danny Elfman  - ‘Memories of Astor’ by Yasunori Kanazawa  - ‘Music from the Truman Show’ by Philip Glass  - ‘Key West’ by Xavier Foley Welsh Premiere   - INTERVAL-  - ‘The Trout Quintet’ by Franz Schubert

shows.title: Festival Launch - Suzzie Vango & Children's Festival Chorus
shows.text: The 2025 Festival kicks off with a performance by the Festival Children’s Chorus, led by Suzzie Vango. Suzzie is a renowned conductor, singer and animateur who has led vocal workshops for the London Symphony Orchestra, the National Youth Choir of Great Britain Fellowship Programme and the Association of British Choral Directors.    Mae Gŵyl 2025 yn cychwyn gyda pherfformiad gan Gorws Plant yr Ŵyl, dan arweiniad Suzzie Vango. Mae Suzzie yn arweinydd, canwr ac animateur o fri sydd wedi arwain gweithdai lleisiol ar gyfer Cerddorfa Symffoni Llundain, Rhaglen Cymrodoriaeth Côr Ieuenctid Cenedlaethol Prydain Fawr a Chymdeithas Cyfarwyddwyr Corawl Prydain.

shows.title: BBC National Orchestra of Wales & Kristian Sallinen
shows.text:
Kristian Sallinen   Conductor   
   Claire Barnett-Jones   Mezzo-Soprano   
   Williams   Fantasia on Welsh Nursery Tunes   
   Elgar   Sea Pictures   
   Dvořák   Symphony No. 9 in E minor ‘From the New World’   
  The BBC National Orchestra of Wales return for their annual performance at the Festival. Conductor Kristian Sallinen leads the orchestra in Grace Williams’ ‘Fantasia on Welsh Nursery Tunes’, BBC Cardiff Singer of the World finalist Claire Barnett-Jones joins the orchestra for Elgar’s song cycle ‘Sea Pictures’, and the programme concludes with a staple of the classical repertoire, Dvořák’s ‘New World’ Symphony. This annual performance is one of the highlights of every Festival programme, and this year’s promises to be no different.         Mae Cerddorfa Genedlaethol Gymreig y BBC yn dychwelyd ar gyfer eu perfformiad blynyddol yn yr Ŵyl. Kristian Sallinen sy'n arwain y gerddorfa yn 'Fantasia on Welsh Nursery Tunes' Grace Williams, mae Claire Barnett-Jones, un o gystadleuwyr rownd derfynol Canwr y Byd Caerdydd, yn ymuno â'r gerddorfa i berfformio'r cylch o ganeuon 'Sea Pictures'gan Elgar, ac mae'r rhaglen yn gorffen gydag un o ffefrynnau'r repertoire clasurol, sef Symffoni 'O'r Byd Newydd' Dvořák. Mae'r perfformiad blynyddol hwn yn un o uchafbwyntiau pob rhaglen yr Ŵyl, ac mae'n argoeli na fydd y perfformiad eleni'n eithriad i hynny.

shows.title: Llyr Williams Schubert Lieder & Beethoven’s Piano concerto
shows.text: Llyr Williams accompanies soprano Ilar Toft in a Schubert Leider recital      Die Junge Nonne        Gretchen am Spinnrade    Erlkoenig    Nacht und Traume    Die Forelle    Staendchen    Schubert died at the age of 31, he left around 600 Lieder, sometimes composing as many as seven songs a day. His mastery of giving each of his poets an unmistakable musical voice is unsurpassed, and so is the overwhelming number of his settings dealing with death and his longing for finding eternal peace. In the this recital we hear the talented local soprano Ilar Toft give her interpretations accompanied by one of Wales' most accomplished pianists. Llyr Williams.    Interval    Beethoven's piano concerto No4 with Llyr Williams and the Nicola Thomas string ensemble.

shows.title: Schubert's Trout & Ravel's String Quartet
shows.text: Alkyona Quartet      Alex Jones  Double Bass     Jocelyn Freeman  Piano    The dynamic Alkyona Quartet team up with BBC NOW Double Bassist Alex Jones and Festival Artist in Residence Jocelyn Freeman for Schubert’s ever-popular Trout Quintet. The Quartet will also mark the 150th anniversary of Ravel’s birth with a performance of his String Quartet in F major.

shows.text: Abigail Blake:      The sleeping-mat ballad Judith Weir     Oh, soft was the songOp. 59 No. 3 Edward Elgar     Liebest du um Schönheit &       Warum willst du and're fragen   from   Lieder Op. 12 Clara Schumann     Von ewiger Liebe Op. 43 No. 1  Johannes Brahms     En Mer      Bonjour mon Coeur  Pauline Viardot          Guto Jenkins:      Ev'ry Valley   from   Messiah HWV 56 	  George Frideric Handel     Dalla sua pace   from  Don Giovanni K. 527 	  Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart      Die Forelle (The Trout) D. 550 Franz Schubert      Ye people rend your hearts   from   Elijah Op. 70  Felix Mendelssohn      Trefin  Neil Cox           Duet:      Familien-Gemälde Op. 34 No. 4 Robert Schumann         Join our fabulous choral scholars, Abigail Blake, Alto, and Guto Jenkins, Tenor in a recital of arias, art songs and lieder.    Ymunwch â'n hysgolorion corawl gwych, Abigail Blake, Alto, a Guto Jenkins, Tenor, mewn datganiad o ariâu, caneuon celf a lieder.

shows.title: Connaught Brass
shows.text: Fire!  Carlos Simon  (UK Premiere)            Three Canzonas  Giovanni Gabrieli arr. Henry Howey     Suite Bergamasque  Claude Debussy arr. Zöe Tweed            Pavane  Gabriel Fauré arr. William Foster     West Side Story  Leonard Bernstein arr. Jack Glade         Following their last-minute COVID cancellation in 2022, Connaught Brass return in 2025 for their Festival debut, in a programme featuring Fauré’s Pavane, Bernstein’s music for West Side Story and a UK premiere of a commission by African-American composer Carlos Simon.    Ar ôl iddynt orfod canslo eu perfformiad yn 2022 oherwydd COVID, bydd Connaught Brass yn dychwelyd yn 2025 ar gyfer eu hymddangosiad cyntaf yn yr Ŵyl, mewn rhaglen sy'n cynnwys Pavane Fauré, cerddoriaeth Bernstein ar gyfer West Side Story a'r perfformiad cyntaf yn y Deyrnas Unedig o ddarn sydd wedi'i gomisiynu a gyfansoddwyd gan y cyfansoddwr Affricanaidd-Americanaidd Carlos Simon.

shows.title: Music for a Summer's Evening
shows.text: O nata lux    Thomas Tallis      Hail, gladdening light    Owain Park     Hymn to the Creator of Light    John Rutter     Lux aeterna    Sarah Quartel     Songbird    Quartel     Piano Solo: Nocturno    Clara Schumann     In manus tuas I    John Sheppard     Nocturnes    Morten Lauridsen    I. Sa nuit d’été    II. Soneto de la noche    III. Sure on this shining night    IV. Epilogue – Voici le soir     INTERVAL      The Goslings  Frederick Bridge      The Long Day Closes  Arthur Sullivan      It was a lover and his lass  John Rutter     Misty  arr. Anders Edenroth     Piano Solo: Some enchanted evening  Rodgers & Hammerstein     The Bouquet  Kara Stacy Bedwell     Libertango  Astor Piazzolla arr. Oscar Escalada     Fair Phyllis I saw  John Farmer      The Silver Swan  Orlando Gibbons      Now is the month of maying  Thomas Morley arr. E. Walters         Join our resident adult singers alongside soloist Jocelyn Freeman in this Bank Holiday Monday spectacular. Expect sumptuous choral singing and light-hearted madrigals, perfect for a summer’s evening.    Ymunwch â'n cantorion preswyl sy'n oedolion ochr yn ochr â'r unawdydd Jocelyn Freeman yn y perfformiad arbennig hwn ar gyfer Dydd Llun Gŵyl y Banc. Gallwch ddisgwyl clywedcanu corawl godidog a madrigalau ysgafn, sy'n berffaith ar gyfer noson wanwynol.

shows.title: Nosferatu with Alexander Mason
shows.text: Rounding off our bumper bank holiday series of events is a screening of the 1922 silent film  Nosferatu:   A Symphony of Horror , accompanied with an organ improvisation by Alexander Mason, former Organist & Master of the Choristers.    I gwblhau'r gyfres helaeth o ddigwyddiadau sydd gennym ar ŵyl y banc, ceir dangosiad o'r ffilm fudo 1922, Nosferatu:   A Symphony of Horror , ynghyd â datganiad byrfyfyr ar yr organ gan Alexander Mason, cyn-organydd a Meistr y Côr.

shows.title: Young Musician of Dyfed
shows.text: The winner of the annual Young Musician of Dyfed competition will perform in this morning recital. Full details to be released following the competition final in April.    Bydd enillydd cystadleuaeth flynyddol Cerddor Ifanc Dyfed yn perfformio yn y datganiad boreol hwn. Bydd y manylion llawn yn cael eu rhyddhau yn dilyn rownd derfynol y gystadleuaeth ym mis Ebrill.

shows.title: A Poet's Love
shows.text: Die Forelle, Der Fischer  Franz Schubert   Cwmdonkin Songs  Rhian Samuel  I. For as long as forever is  II. Clown in the moon  II. Mr Waldo's Song   All, all and all   Isabella Gillis     In the beginning   from   The Fields of Praise William Mathias   And death shall have no dominion Meirion Williams   Logan Clark:    Risorga il Mondo   from   La Resurrezione George Frideric Handel   Chanson d'Avril Georges Bizet   Kizzy Lumley-Edwards:    Dylluan Deg Dilys Elwyn Edwards   Tiger   from   Zaide Mozart   Trio:    Soave sia il vento   from   Così fan tutte  Mozart   INTERVAL    Dichterliebe  Robert Schumann        Artist in Residence Jocelyn Freeman is joined by renowned tenor James Gilchrist and his students from the Royal Welsh College of Music and Drama for an evening of song celebrating great poetry. The first half sees a collection of settings of the poetry of Dylan Thomas by Welsh composers William Mathias, Meirion Williams and Rhian Samuel. The second half sees Gilchrist and Freeman combine forces for Schumann’s Dichterliebe (‘A Poet’s Love’), one of the great romantic song cycles.         Bydd y tenor enwog James Gilchrist a'i fyfyrwyr o Goleg Brenhinol Cerdd a Drama Cymru yn ymuno â'n Hartist Preswyl, Jocelyn Freeman, am noson o gân sy'n dathlu barddoniaeth wych. Yn yr hanner cyntaf, ceir casgliad o osodiadau o farddoniaeth Dylan Thomas gan y cyfansoddwyr Cymreig William Mathias, Meirion Williams a Rhian Samuel. Yn yr ail hanner, bydd Gilchrist a Freeman yn dod ynghyd i berfformio Dichterliebe ('Cariad Bardd') gan Schumann, un o'r cylchoedd o ganeuon rhamantaidd mawr.

shows.title: Coffee Concert: Organ Scholar
shows.text: Variations de Concert  Joseph Bonnet     Preludio Sine Nomine  Herbert Howells     A verse of Three parts  Thomas Tomkins           Fancy  Tomkins     Introduction and Passacaglia  Josef Rheinberger     Andante Tranquilo   from   Sonata No. 3 in A major Op. 65 Felix Mendelssohn     Fantasia and Fugue in G minor BWV 542  Johann Sebastian Bach         Organ Scholar Felix Petheu gives an organ recital on the 1883 Father Willis organ.    Mae'r ysgolor organ Felix Petheu yn rhoi datganiad ar organ y Tad Willis o 1883.

shows.title: Arty Party / Arti Parti
shows.text:
SPAN's New Year's Arty Party     Join SPAN for a Spring Time Arty Party on the 28 May, a networking
event designed for freelancers in the creative arts community of West Wales.   Join us for an exciting evening at SPAN’s New Year Arty
Party from 5pm until 7pm on Wednesday the 28 th  of May and enjoy
snacks, drinks and good company. It is a fantastic opportunity to connect with
fellow creatives, share ideas for the year ahead, and learn about upcoming
events and opportunities from the SPAN team.    

  This
is a FREE event but booking is required via our website. For more information
call 01834 869323, visit span-arts.org.uk or contact info@span-arts.org.  

        

          

    Event
Details    

   Time: 5pm until 7pm   

   Location: SPAN
Arts Building, Town Moor, Narberth. SA67 7AG   

   Price: FREE.    

  Book: Advanced booking required.

shows.title: The Queen's Six - Mapping the Stars
shows.text: Hence stars, too dim of light  Michael East     Sfogava con le stelle  Claudio Monteverdi     Factum est silentium  Richard Dering     Quemadmodum  John Taverner     Labovari in gemitu meo  Alfonso Ferrabosco I/II     This endris night  Sarah Quartel     Mapping the stars  Toby Young     INTERVAL      The Vatican Rag  Tom Lehrer, arr. Dan Brittain      Sun, moon, sea and stars  Bob Chilcott     When you wish upon a star  Harline/Washington, arr. Ruairi Bowen     A star is born  Menken/Zippel, arr. Ana Krstajic     Heaven is a place on earth  Nowels/Shpley, arr. Miguel Esteban     Viva la vida  Berryman/Buckland/Champion/Martin, arr. Simon Whiteley     We built this city on rock and roll  Starship, arr. Louis Marlowe    Rounding off this year’s Festival is a performance by the Queen’s Six, a fabulous acapella sextet formed from members of the choir of St George’s Chapel, Windsor. Their programme, ‘Mapping the Stars’ features works by Monteverdi, Taverner and Dering alongside arrangements of ‘When you wish upon a star’ and Coldplay’s ‘Viva la vida’ to bring the Festival to a close.     Mae Gŵyl eleni yn tynnu at ei therfyn gyda pherfformiad gan The Queen's Six, chwechawd a capella gwych a ffurfiwyd o   aelodau o gôr Capel San Siôr, Windsor. Mae eu rhaglen, 'Mapio'r Sêr', yn cynnwys darnau gan Monteverdi, Taverner a Dering ochr yn ochr â threfniannau o 'When you wish upon a star', a 'Viva la vida' gan Coldplay i ddod â'r Ŵyl i ben.

shows.title: Young Promoters Pembrokeshire presents: Nookee + support from Queen Beezie
Sonic Sounds + Good Nature Party + FLORENCE ADOONI
A BIG BOLD BEAUTIFUL JOURNEY (12A TBC)
Peggy Seeger – 90th Birthday Farewell Tour
shows.text: Peggy Seeger – 90th Birthday Farewell Tour With Neill & Calum MacColl. Peggy Seeger, the grande dame of American and British Folk music, embarks on her last ever concert tour alongside her sons, Neill and Calum MacColl, in celebration of her 90th Birthday in June 2025.    Peggy has been performing for over seventy-five years and will showcase some of her best loved songs from across her extraordinary career, as well as new songs from her final album (out Spring 2025).         “Peggy Seeger inspires; as funny, feisty and angry as ever” The Guardian    “Peggy’s a vital presence, ready with a quip or a homily ... Through their warmth, unity and ease of communication, she and her sons reaffirm folk song’s status as the bringer of news and its ability to address any issue.”The Times“Folk music with a raunchy wink; think Victoria Wood meets Dory Previn. Peggy imparts her wise and optimistic world view with joy and a wonderful lightness of touch -a masterclass in storytelling through music.”Daily Telegraph

shows.title: Cân Sing Span Arts Singing Workshops
shows.text:
Cân Sing will now be taking place at the SPAN Building,     Narberth  , at the regular time of 7.00 pm - 9.00 pm       Limited sapces - Book by choosing the date below.    

  Cân Sing is a relaxed environment in which we sing for the sake of singing!  

  Join vocal practitioner Molara for an exploratory celebration of singing, work on strengthening the voice, overcoming some of the physical and emotional barriers to singing openly and freely, and above all singing for enjoyment.  
  The repertoire is varied with songs from Georgia, Ghana, Zimbabwe, and Hawaii with a few shanties and some pop thrown in for good measure.  
  The group has been meeting for many years, with new additions along the way. It's perfect if you are looking to sing regularly in a pressure free environment, or whether you fancy dropping in for a sing every so often. The pace of the teaching is easily accessible to all, with no time restraints.  
  Every 1st and 3rd Monday of the month, except Bank Holidays.  

          7.00 pm - 9.00 pm      SPAN Arts Building, Narberth SA67 7AG   
   Sessions £7     For ticket holders who need access support to attend, we offer a free ticket for their companion, carer, or personal assistant. Contact    01834 869323  to book your carers ticket.

shows.title: Il Barbiere di Siviglia (12A AS LIVE TBC)
The Green Room Sessions
shows.text:
Green Room Session: Meet the Funder   Join us for the next in our Green Room series—artist-focused workshops run by the SPAN team and partners, designed to support and strengthen professional creative skills.  This session offers local freelance creatives a valuable opportunity to meet Suzanne Griffiths-Rees, Development Officer at Arts Council of Wales. With over 20 years of experience, Suzanne will guide attendees through current funding opportunities, share insights, and answer questions to help demystify the application process.  🗓  Date:  Tuesday 3rd June
 🕕  Time:  6:00pm – 7:30pm
 📍  Location:  SPAN Arts, Town Moor, Narberth, SA67 7AG  



   Free to attend. Booking is essential. 
Open to freelance creatives working in any artform and based in West Wales.    If we can make this workshop more accessible to you, please get in touch with Bethan Morgan on info@span-arts.org.uk. The sessions are  FREE but
advanced booking is required. For more information about the workshops and to
book, please go to span-arts.org.uk or email   info@spanarts.org  .uk

shows.title: Foraging, remedies and folklore
shows.subtitle: Salena Walker
shows.text:
Wild Welsh Herbalism
This talk explores the rich herbal traditions of Wales, focusing on the medicinal and edible plants found in local hedgerows, gardens, and wild spaces.
Topics covered will include:
Herbs Close to Home – Exploring the medicinal uses of plants growing in gardens, local land and the wild. Traditional Remedies – How these plants have been used for health and wellbeing in Wales over generations. Welsh Herbal Folklore – Stories and traditions that connect people to the land and its plants. The talk will be given by Salena Walker, a practitioner of Wild Welsh herbalism with over 20 years of teaching experience and a lifelong connection to growing medicinal plants. Her work brings together traditional herbal knowledge and sustainable living, helping others reconnect with the healing power of local plants. This talk offers an opportunity to deepen your knowledge of local plants, their practical applications, and their place in Wel

shows.title: SAMANA-a live shamanic performance & cinematic experience
shows.text: As multi-disciplinary artists, Samana weaves together their poetry, music, striking photography, and fine art into a single, transformative and immersive experience. Every element of their work is crafted with ritualistic devotion, recorded in their analogue studio, The Road Records, and developed in the darkroom tucked away in the remote hills of Wales.  Their music confronts the most profound aspects of the human condition, embracing both its weight and its transcendence. It invites us to reclaim our time, our essence, and our place within the natural world, urging a journey beyond our limitations. Oscillating between melancholic ballads and spiritual awakenings, Samana’s sound guides listeners through cinematic landscapes, invoking ancient beliefs, revolution, healing, the unseen, and the profound depths of love, loss, and death. Born from a nomadic existence and steeped in solitude, Samana’s work draws heavily from the philosophy of dreams, the subconscious, and the transformative power of improvisation. Each song pulses with ethereal energy and unfiltered emotional honesty, offering a direct passage to the spirit—stripping away illusions and revealing the raw, shamanic force that connects us to the very core of our being. This is music that speaks to the soul, igniting the heart and awakening the inner sanctum of our existence.    watch video    https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uMBfKF9pzdU

shows.title: Claire Jones and Studio47 ‘s Musical Celebration
Summer solstice with Julie Murphy and Ceri Rhys Matthews
shows.text: This evening's Summer Solstice event will feature singers, musicians, poets and a few surprises to take you into the dawn of summer. Julie Murphy and Ceri Rhys Matthews are the headline act for the evening. Julie Murphy (voice and shruti box) and Ceri Rhys Matthews (flute) are founder members of groundbreaking Welsh folk group Fernhill. Together they perform traditional songs and dance tunes from Wales and beyond, with particular emphasis on the music and poetry of West Wales. Their exquisite musical evocations of landscape and culture are timeless and universal. They have toured worldwide and their music has been featured on BBC Radio 3’s In Tune and Late junction, BBC Radio Cymru, BBC Alba, BBC Radio 2 and stations across Europe.

shows.title: The Merry Widow-Friday
shows.text: PLEASE NOTE 6 PM START    This year's Rhosygilwem'r summer opera production will be Franz Lehar's The Merry Widow, conducted by James Southall, directed by Fleur Snow and featuring Catrin Aur in the title role of the Merry Widow. This will be a sumptuous production with orchestra and chorus, sung in English. This charming, uplifting comedy The Merry Widow  plays out in a stream of memorable melodies. It centres on the relationship between the wealthy young widow Hanna and the cad Danilo, who has an appetite for wine and women. As this delightful tale of a woman’s quest for love unfolds, their burgeoning romance is hampered by mishap, intrigue and comedic misadventure.

shows.title: The Merry Widow-Saturday
shows.text: This year's Rhosygilwem'r summer opera production will be Franz Lehar's The Merry Widow, conducted by James Southall, directed by Fleur Snow and featuring Catrin Aur in the title role of the Merry Widow. This will be a sumptuous production with orchestra and chorus, sung in English. This charming, uplifting comedy The Merry Widow  plays out in a stream of memorable melodies. shows.title: NT Live: A Streetcar Named Desire (15)
Carwyn Graves
shows.text:
A talk and discussion with Carwyn Graves.
Carwyn is author of Tir: The Story of the Welsh Landscape; Welsh Food Stories ("best food policy book in 2022" - BBC Radio 4 Food Programme); Apples of Wales, and many other publications. He is a lecturer at the University of Wales (Lampeter) and is a regular writer, broadcaster and speaker on Welsh food heritage and policy.
Carwyn is a founding trustee of Cegin y Bobl, the People's Kitchen, which aims to improve food choices in Wales through workshops and courses for people in all walks of life.
Carwyn lives in Carmarthen and has roots in North Pembrokeshire. Many of his talks and publications are in Welsh. For some years, he led a team creating a modern Welsh translation of the Bible.

shows.title: Jackie Morris and Nia Harris
shows.text: The Unwinding    A meditation in music, word and image from Nia Harries and Jackie Morris.    In 2020 a small book was published. The book’s aim was to be a refuge for the troubled soul. Now the book has become a performance by acclaimed cellist Nia Harries, accompanied by the words and images from the book. Described by Maria Popover  of The Marginalia as “An uncommonly enchanted painted poem celebrating the wilderness of the imagination and our capacity for love, trust, and hope.’    The musical  composition for the Unwinding uses the cello to it's full, technically virtuosic with rich expressive harmonies, as well as simple plain melodies drawing on the tradition of Welsh folk songs. There are dramatic changes of texture and mood within the music, closely interwoven with the poetry and stunning art work.     Jackie Morris is an author and illustrator. Her works include The Lost Words and The Lost Spells, co-created with Robert Macfarlane, and The Unwinding, an illustrated book for dreamers, published by Unbound. Her works have been translated into many languages, though as she says, images need no translation. She has illustrated and written over 60 books, and now her work focusses on both peace and protest, in the most beautiful way possible.

shows.title: Cleif Harpwood
shows.subtitle: (Edward H Dafis) yng nghwmni Geraint Cynan
shows.text:
Noson fendigedig o ganeuon telynegol a straeon yng Nghapel Bethel. Efallai bod Cleif yn fwyaf adnabyddus fel prif leisydd y band chwedlonol Edward H Dafis o’r 1970au, ac yn gyfansoddwr nifer o ganeuon poblogaidd fel Ysbryd y nos, Mistar Duw, a Cân yn ofer. Yng nghwmni’r cerddor adnabyddus Geraint Cynan, mae’n canu caneuon o'r gorffennol a rhai cyfoes, ac yn adrodd straeon ei fywyd a chaneuon ar hyd y daith.
Cyflwynir yn Gymraeg (cyfeillgar i ddysgwr!)
~
A wonderful evening of lyrical songs and stories in Bethel Chapel. Cleif is perhaps best known as lead singer of the legendary 1970s band Edward H Dafis, and the composer of many popular numbers such as Ysbryd y nos, Mistar Duw, and Cân yn ofer. Accompanied by well-known musician Geraint Cynan, he sings songs from then and now, and tells stories of his life and songs along the way.

shows.title: Swyn- Collective Flight Syrcas
shows.text:
Swyn  (the Welsh word for “spell” or
“charm”) is an atmospheric, multi-sensory experience that honours the women and
the work that came before us. Through a powerful fusion of contemporary circus,
acrobatic dance, bilingual storytelling, and original song, this performance
evokes themes of memory, ancestry, and belonging. The show is performed on an
outdoor aerial rig, surrounded by symbolic props—pails of water, large pots of
flowers—and accompanied by a bespoke soundtrack that draws the audience into a
world both timeless and immediate.    Parking Information 
 Please note that parking at Colby Woodland Garden can be very busy, and we are unable to guarantee spaces. We kindly advise ticket holders to arrive early to allow plenty of time to park. Alternatively, you may wish to park in Amroth and enjoy the short walk up to the venue.       Location: The Meadow, Colby Woodland
Gardens, Pembrokeshire    Date: Saturday 2nd August 2025    Times: Performance 1 – 1pm |
Performance 2 – 4pm (each approx. 45 minutes)   





 Tickets: Pay What You
Can – starting at £5

shows.title: The Woolverstones + The Adventures Of Bert & Henry
WordPlay
shows.subtitle: An evening of Poetry and Music
shows.text:
An evening of poetry and music, and dinner.
Word Play was forged among the rocks of the Preseli Hills and the west Wales coastline. A shared love of their landscape and its languages brought its members together in addition to a keenly felt respect for the history of this region; twinned with an appreciation of the originality of each other’s work, whatever the subject matter.
Formed in 2024, Word Play is a small collective of award-winning poets and singer-song writers. Six distinct voices spanning the worlds of poetry and folk music. Inventive and lively, haunting and vividly imagined, their combined strengths are gentled by the sonorous grace of their language: Word Play, at its best. This marriage of poetry and music harks back to historical examples of collaborating to entertain one’s local community such as the Noson Lawen.
Word Play are: Annie Butler, landscape artist and award-winning poet; Paul Steffan Jones multi-published poet; Paul Hayes a

Claire Roberts-From Wales to South America
shows.text: a singer and violinist originally from Wales but now living in Spain. Every year I still come back to tour the UK, in 2024 playing both London Jazz Festival and Manchester Jazz Festival. This year will be embarking on a tour in collaboration with classical string quartet, 'From Wales to South America', performing folk songs and traditional music from both Wales and Argentina (where in Patagonia there is a Welsh settlement.) They bring this multilingual music programme to us in English, Spanish ac yn y Gymraeg.    Here is a link to Claire performing the 2021 'Chanson' project    https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qssw4dM8fO0    Read about her music in The Welsh Review    https://www.walesartsreview.org/claire-victoria-roberts-composing-expectations/
